docs.title: WoWScout
docs.text:
WoWScout is a tool to view details about your world of warcraft characters and account.

NOTE: Still very much under development, so not much to see here.

You can find the documentation here

docs.title: Getting Started (Development)
docs.text: The project currently relies on docker and docker compose for local development.

docs.title: .env files
docs.text:
You will need to setup your .env file for the compose stack.

ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Production
BLIZZARD_CLIENT_ID=
BLIZZARD_CLIENT_SECRET=
BLIZZARD_REDIRECT_URI=

If you are actively contributing to WoWScout, you can retrieve the values from me. Otherwise, you will need to setup a client here.

docs.title: Compose stack
docs.text:
To start the compose stack in development/watch mode, you can do so with the following command:

docker compose watch

docs.title: Accessing the API
docs.text:
Currently the API is the only functional part, you will be able to view the swagger docs at http://localhost:8080/swagger/index.html.

NOTE: All the auth endpoints need to be accessed directly in the browser but you can view their documentation on the swagger docs.

docs.title: Planning - V1
docs.text:
The project will should allow users to do the following things in the V1 release:

  • List all game characters for the user.
    • They will have the following fields shown:
      • Name
      • Realm
      • Class
      • Race
      • Faction
      • Level
    • The user will be able to view the total characters, total alliance characters and total horde characters on the cards.
    • The user will be allowed to filter characters based on region.
  • View the details of a character.
    • Cards with various different information.
    • Equipment pane.
    • Charts highlighting stat changes for character.

docs.title: Using the Blizzard APIs
docs.text:
To use the blizzard APIs, we need to setup OAuth client flows.

This will entail

  • Having a login page.
  • Login page takes you to Blizzard OAuth.
  • Blizzard OAuth redirects to local with auth code.
  • We retrieve token for user, and pass it back to be stored in cookie storage.
